result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Right to counsel.  Response by Defendant - is trying to retain an attorney on his own.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.

1:41 PM - case called.  Defendant Timothy R Gilson appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court questions Defendant regarding bond.  Responses by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
